rationale: The segment describes a current status of the virus and uncertainty, not capability or preparedness.
statement_text: So far, the virus hasn't made the changes that would enable it to become a fully human pathogen, said Dr. Michael Osterholm, who directs the Center for Infectious Disease Research and Policy at the University of Minnesota. It's unclear whether it ever will. "I've been a student of this virus [H5N1].
